intro: Montanoa pyramidata, commonly known as the Mexican tree fern, is a striking evergreen plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and feathery, compound leaves. The plant produces small, white flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by spore-bearing cones. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical forests. Due to its unique appearance and growth habits, it is a popular choice for ornamental gardening in suitable climates.
